body_html:
Thanks @asimshankar ,
I use tensorflow object detection api for medical research.
The data of medical images are not always in uint8 data type.
When I decoded these tfrecord files created from medical uint16 dataset, they are converted to uint8.
I found that object detection api decode tool is based on slim.tfexample_decoder function, and it uses tf.image.decode_image function to decode images.
Therefore, if uint16 data type can be supported, it should make tf.image.decode_image more versatile.

body:
Thanks @asimshankar ,
I use tensorflow object detection api for medical research.
The data of medical images are not always in uint8 data type.
When I decoded these tfrecord files created from medical uint16 dataset, they are converted to uint8.
I found that object detection api decode tool is based on slim.tfexample_decoder function, and it uses tf.image.decode_image function to decode images.
Therefore, if uint16 data type can be supported, it should make tf.image.decode_image more versatile.
